qas.question: When is the Members Debate held?
How long does the Members Debate last?
Why are debates on proposed motions by an MSP conducted?

answers.text: may be of interest to a particular area such as a member's own constituency
issues which may be of interest to a particular area such as a member's own constituency

qas.question: Who contributes to Members Business in addition to the proposer?
What does the minister who was the catalyst of the Members Business do by speaking after everyone else?
A "Members Debate" is usually held immediately before what?
Other member do not normally contribute to what?
What debate is a debate on a motion proposed by an MSP who is not a Scottish minister?

context: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>Immediately after <b5_0>Decision Time<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> a "<b7_0><b8_0>Members Debate<b8_0/><b7_0/>" is held, which lasts for <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>45 minutes<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. Members Business is a debate on a motion proposed by an MSP who is <a2_0>not a Scottish minister<a2_0/>. Such motions are on <a2_2>issues which <a2_1>may be of interest to a particular area such as a member's own constituency<a2_2/><a2_1/>, an upcoming or past event or any other item which would otherwise not be accorded official parliamentary time. As well as the proposer, <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>other members<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> normally contribute to the <b6_0>debate<b6_0/>. The relevant minister, whose department the debate and motion relate to <a4_2>"<a4_0><a4_1>winds up<a4_1/><a4_0/>" the debate<a4_2/> by speaking after all other participants.
